subject: Fashion
title: Landfill Mountains of Clothes
description: A quick win: understand Landfill Mountains of Clothes.

hook.text: The world throws away one garbage truck of textiles every single second of every day.

buildup.text: In the U.S. alone, 85% of all textiles end up in landfillsâ€”about 11 million tons a year.

discovery.text: Most synthetic fabrics take 200+ years to decompose. That polyester dress will outlive your grandchildren.

twist.text: Donating doesn't always help. Only 10-20% of donated clothes are resold. The rest often go to landfills.

climax.text: We're not running out of closet space. We're running out of places to hide what we throw away.

punchline.text: A garbage truck of clothes, every second. Every day.

quiz.question: What percentage of textiles in the U.S. end up in landfills?
